title: How to Build Your Own Coffee Table

methods.name: Select a Top for Your Coffee Table

steps.headline: Search for salvaged materials for your table top.
steps.description: One of the surest ways to make your DIY coffee table unique is to repurpose a piece of salvaged material for the tabletop. An old door can be sawn to size for this purpose, as can a piece of wood salvaged from an old building.

steps.headline: Purchase a precut tabletop from a furniture store.
steps.description: Some furniture stores sell ready-made desktops and tabletops in several standard sizes. Buying a top like this will help make your DIY coffee table an inexpensive and easy project. Tabletops in solid wood can even be stained or painted to suit your preferences.

steps.headline: Select a wooden board from a hardware store.
steps.description: Many home improvement stores will cut wood boards to size for free upon purchase. This option will give you the most control over the exact dimensions of the coffee table without even having to make any cuts yourself.

methods.name: Choose Legs for Your Coffee Table

steps.headline: Consider ready-made table legs.
steps.description: Furniture stores that sell precut tabletops often sell ready-to-install table legs as well. Ready-made legs offer one of the least costly ways to build your coffee table, and are available in a range of different styles and materials, including wood and polished metal.

steps.headline: Look for hairpin legs online.
steps.description: To give your DIY coffee table a nod to classic mid-century Scandinavian design, you can fit it with metal hairpin legs. Vintage hairpin legs can be found readily through Internet classifieds or auction sites like eBay. You can also have new ones made through an online metal shop.

steps.headline: Choose no-hardware legs for easy and flexible installation.
steps.description: Some companies manufacture table legs that can be installed without any fasteners; this allows you to install them easily and swap out the tabletop if desired. One such product is the Tick Clip, produced by the German company Linie 58.

steps.headline: Salvage legs from an old piece of furniture.
steps.description: If you have an existing table, dresser, or other piece of furniture with attractive legs, you can remove them and give them new life as part of your DIY coffee table. This method can help you preserve a piece of furniture with sentimental value in a new form.

methods.name: Affix the Legs to the Tabletop

steps.headline: Purchase the right type of fasteners.
steps.description: Screws are the most effective and versatile type of fastener for affixing legs to a table top. Purchase wood screws or metal screws depending on the material your tabletop is made from. You can further strengthen a joint using glue if desired.

steps.headline: Drill pilot holes for the fasteners.
steps.description: With the tabletop on the floor, position the legs where they will be installed. Use an electric drill to create pilot holes for the screws, which will prevent the drill bit from binding or the tabletop from splitting.

steps.headline: Secure the fasteners.
steps.description: Once the pilot holes are drilled, use your drill or a screwdriver to tighten the fasteners and secure the legs to the tabletop. Once all the screws are tightened, turn the coffee table right-side-up and move it to its new home.
